intro: Leptorhynchos nitidulus, commonly known as the smooth-leaved rock cress, is a small, flowering plant native to rocky and arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters, with hairy stems and alternate, linear leaves. Its flowers are small and white or pale yellow, arranged in racemes, and it produces small, round pods containing several seeds. This species is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments and is often found in crevices or on rocky outcrops.
